text: “Victory was in your grasp… so close you could taste it. Yet, all history will remember is that you lost.”
“You may call it a victory, I call it fortunate.”
“Oh dear. My kin are all laughing at you. Perhaps try issuing a few orders next time?”
“You reek of defeat. A stink far worse than a Great Unclean One.”
“No mere victory: fates were re-written, destinies ended and the immutable changed. All because of you.”
“The only winner here is the Blood God, and He is no master of mine!”
The enemy commander defeated your lord in a duel.
“I see no heroes here. Only pawns playing their roles. Prove me wrong.”
“A hollow victory. Maybe we should just call it a loss?”
You have bested the enemy commander in a duel. Their army retreats.
“Others will call this valiant or even courageous… It is still a defeat.”
More blood for the blood god! To think that mere mortals could defile the Brass Citadel of Khorne.
The Ice Queen has vanquished the gatekeeper and defiled the Brass Citadel. Khorne will rage at this desecration! Her search for what is lost continues.
You are cast from the Altar of Battle in defeat! You are nought but a disappointment in the eyes of your Dark God.
You are the Champion of Chaos! You have proven yourself before the Dark Gods and all who would dare challenge your might!

You are cast from the Forge of Souls in defeat. Yet… if you hurry, there just might still be time to stop the Dark Master attaining Godhood. Return to your empire and build a more formidable army to face Be’lakor once more!
Revel in victory, for you have dethroned an ascendant Godling! Be’lakor will be cast back into the shadows, and the prize awaits you in the lower-levels of the forge.
More skulls for the Blood God! To think that your pathetic armies could defile the Brass Citadel of Khorne.
Khorne will rage at this desecration! To come before the Brass Citadel and slay His Gatekeeper... you have made an enemy of the Blood God but are victorious nonetheless!
The grounds before the Plaguelord's mansion are ever-hungry for nutrients, and the bodies of your army will fester and fertilise the rancid soil. Defeat was inevitable.
Nurgle's Daemon Prince, the Gardener, is vanquished. Claim his soul before his body rots. Then you must leave, for when you are this close to the God of Decay no immunity will last.

You made it past the Six Circles of Seduction, an epic feat in and of itself, but to march upon the Palace of Slaanesh and claim the twisted soul of the Courtesan was a challenge too far. You are defeated.
The Courtesan is slain. You have defiled the very heart of the Dark Prince's realm to claim your prize. Take it before your army is lured into the Palace, from which no being ever returns!

Your quest ends in defeat, your army destroyed by the forces of the Great Sorcerer and His Daemon Prince. To come so far and yet fall so short… You may not have known the outcome, but Tzeentch surely did.
The favoured Daemon Prince of Tzeentch, the Librarian, has been brought low. Securing his soul was inevitable… but was it the Great Sorcerer's plan all along?
